Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery cup-skyphos; profiled outer edge of lip; interior: reserved band at rim. glazed black below; exterior: lip glazed; band at top of wall; below, black-figure decoration consisting of female figure to left (head and neck with added white flesh and added red fillet or wreath); trace of decoration at right break.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0348) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
